I had a situation where I needed a handicap accessible apartment immediately for my mother and they went above and beyond my expectations in helping me to find the perfect place for her. I couldn't have accompished this without Paula's hard work and determination. Thank you again Paula and all your staff!!

Report
Prospective Resident
Visited 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/05/2017
Worth reading before you look at Beech Lake apartments. I found the perfect apartment... And then had it ripped away from me. The apartment was second-floor vaulted ceilings 934 sq ft 1 bedroom/1 bath with an extra Den, wooded view, classic renovation which meant tan color scheme and new carpet no washer and dryer but that was OK because I have my own. I had put my admin fee and application fee in for Beech Lake Apartments on Sunday April 30th, 2017. This was for a move-in date of May 18th, 2017. They called on Monday May 1st, 2017, after receiving my pre-approval email on Sunday aftn and stated they were going to be renovating the apartment that I had reserved. Well I got excited like every other tenant would, until they added a "but" to the sentence. "But, I will have to charge you an extra $125 dollars per month!" Because we are renovating this unit. I was already at the top of my budget and decided that I could not even entertain another $125. I tried to see if there was anyway that they could hold off on the renovations until my 13 month lease was up and they stated that there was no way of them doing this. I am just very hurt that even though I paid for my admin and applications fees to be able to hold that specific apartment for that specific amount they did something so underhanded and wanted to charge me more. These people are scam artists. I did speak with the manager Paula and she offered me another one bedroom apartment no den, bottom floor, no washer and dryer for the same initial rent that I had been given for my dream unit. In other words an apartment with 154 sq ft less and on the first floor with a parking lot view. Definitely not an offer I was going to take her up on. She then offered to lower the rent to $75 more per month. Still way out of my range. She said that if I wasn't going to take either of the two offers that I wasn't going to be renting from them. All of this aside...Ashley and Derrick both are amazing sales people and seriously the best people to work with throughout this process. Before all the craziness happened they were both very professional and courteous. Ashley was amazing at selling us on the unit and checking off all of my 'wants' in a rental. Derrick was very very nice and very personable when we were putting in our application and admin fees. This property is very beautiful but they need to be more truthful and check their facts before they set a rents. I believe they saw an opportunity to get more rent from the unit and found a way to dissolve our agreement in order to do so. I did get back my admin fee and deposit. Only because I first until I got it. Still very disappointed overall.

I loved been at beech lake the community is very charming and quite. The neighbors are very welcoming and outgoing. When I first moved In it was under Westdale management it was good but when capreit took over it became so much better. Paula the community manager is wonderful I never had any issue with the office staff all the maintenance issue were handled in a timely manner loved it I highly recommend moving in here.

Report
Resident
2016 - 2017 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/18/2017
I wish I could give 0 stars! I read the reviews on this apartment complex before moving in and just like everyone else I decided that situations happen and I would find out for myself. There are some petty people out there that you just can't please. Well unfortunately in the case of Beech Lake all the negative reviews are legit. I had a great signup experience and the office manager was the one who assisted me. She was terrific. I have no complaints about her personality or professionalism. After moving in everything just got worse. I've had to have my washing machine fixed 3 times now and this last time it took me calling the office 3 days after placing my maintenance request for them to come out to fix it. The woman on the phone was nice and did tell me she would send someone out right away. But 3 times its broken in 1 year has been extremely inconvenient. While on vacation apparently my air conditioning unit was not working and water was leaking down into apartments below it. Maintenance came in and fixed the issue but never retouched up my walls. I now have a huge water stain underneath the unit which I am assuming is now growing mold due to their lack of cleaning it up. This I have found out has resulted in my water bill being double the normal amount for 6 months. Management did not offer me anything for the expense that was not my fault but fault in their equipment. Also, when I moved in a new assistant office manager was starting named Richard, he had no idea what he was doing and was left there on a Sunday by himself. He seemed frustrated and confused and took it out on the tenants who came in to ask questions. I chalked it up to him being new and lack of training. Well its been about 10 months now and he is still as rude as ever! He has an excuse for everything even when you go in for a simple request of picking up a package, ie hes too busy, they had training, theres nothing he can do about, etc etc etc. Its like they got you to sign a lease so your locked in and now they can treat you like crap and be as rude as possible because you can't go anywhere without it costing you a lot of money. I'm sorry but the tenants are the reason you have a job in the first place. My recommendation to management.. fire him, hes costing you bad reviews and hes one of the reasons I am not renewing my lease. The thefts and vandalism are still going on. One day I walked out to my car and found one of the maintenance staff tires had all been slashed. Now whether that was coincidence or a tenant was extremely mad at him should speak for itself. I do not believe ever in ruining someones property but this is a prime example of the type of tenants the place attracts or the lack of skill the maintenance team has. Either one is a red flag! I received a letter reminding me that my 60 day renewal was coming up which I appreciated the reminder. But with it they increased my rent $80 a month. That is crazy! I understand rent increases but not by that much. When I looked at the board of available apartments I saw that my same apartment sq ft was being rented out for less than what they wanted to raise mine to. So I put in my notice! I found an apartment in Brier Creek that was way nicer, better pool, huge gym, and great area for less then what Beech Lake wanted to charge me now. My advice, do not move into Beech Lake... find another apartment complex!

ARICH527 02/06/2017

We are sorry to hear that your maintenance issue has not been resolved. We strive to create a 5 Star experience when it comes to service requests, but realize that sometimes those requests may slip through the gaps. We sincerely apologize and will certainly set up an appointment for one of our service team members to take care of your request within the next 24 hours. Please contact us, via phone call or email, with your building and apartment number. Thank you for reaching out to us.

Report
Resident
2015 - 2016 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/15/2016
We have lived at Beech Lake for a little over a year now. It's on a nice side of Durham that isn't that bad. However, in the last few months there has been break-ins and vandalism in the complex. I don't feel that safe here and the office staff (mainly the complex manager, Paula) is very rude. Anytime I have walked into the leasing office she has been rude and stand-offish. I am not sure why she was hired. Her people skills are lacking and she has a nasty attitude. Other than what I just listed beech lake is okay. The maintenance staff is friendly and I haven't had any problems with neighbors. However, with that being said, I still wouldn't recommend this complex to anyone unless you can deal with a obnoxiously rude leasing office manager. Getting her to do anything is like asking a wall to move. Don't count on her to fulfill any requests; she could take weeks to do it.

Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/22/2016
My husband and I used to live here. This is our first apartment since we relocated from Illinois. We moved out on Nov. 26th last year, until now they haven't returned our $306 security deposit. By law, they should return it within 30 days. Our family suggest we should file a case. Every time we call or go to their office, Macy would tell us that it's on the way. Even during our stay, they lie every chance they get. We experienced going home to a damped carpet and sofa because the water pipes burst in winter 2013. The paint chips of our ceiling were falling on the carpet. After weeks of calling their office, they fixed the unit after almost a month. I also remember one of their maintenance staffs telling me that my name is not listed on our contract, blah, blah, blah! She told me all those things before checking our contract. I won't forget her face and how rude she was to me. I will not recommend this place to anyone. Some of them are unprofessional.

Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 11/24/2015
Hate this place. Massive wood roaches every fall, carpet smelled like pee before we cleaned it, musty bathrooms, hear through ceiling quite clearly, lady upstairs lets her dog go onto the deck above ours and pee where it then leaks around her tarp and dribbles onto our porch/patio furniture, they tell you wrong information CONSISTENTLY...its like no one know whats going on and when they tell you wrong things, you get screwed. They are always on lunch when you try and get packages, the laundry facility is gross, they don't do a good job with snow management, they go into your apartment without asking or informing you before hand and then leave you a note after the fact warning you they are coming. They are rude and when you tell them they gave you wrong information they do not hold themselves accountable. Only good thing is that they allow pitbulls, a rare commodity, which is why we had to live here in the first place, we love our rescue so much we put up with this crap for three years.

Report
Resident
2013 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/26/2015
I have lived at Beech Lake for two years, and the place isn't the worst. The layout of the apartment is a bit awkward. The front door of my 1 bedroom opens to a wall. It was hard moving large items like my bed and couches in because of it. Also in my apartment, I was having issues with my plumbing and appliances. My dishwasher leaks, my toilet doesn't flush like it is suppose to, my bathtub doesn't stop up properly when you lift the switch for it to, and if you turned on my stove, it automatically when into self-cleaning mode no matter what degrees I had the knob set at, and was burning anything I put in it. There is not a lot of corner space in the kitchen, and storage space is skim. Maintenance for me was an issue. My heat didn't work the entire winter. I called when I first discovered the problem and someone was sent promptly; however, once he got there, he claimed that the pipes were just frozen and there was nothing he or we could do. Winter turned into spring and we discovered that our air was not working either. Frozen pipes couldn't have been the issue this time around, so I called again. Someone was sent in a timely manner. He inspected everything, and it turned out that my control box had malfunctioned..something that could have completely been fixed the first time. Unfortunately, it always seems to take 2-3 tries for the maintenance men to fix the issues in my apartment...that's if they get fixed at all. Management changes often, so it hard to find someone you can consider reliable to help with any of your issues. The current staff seems nice enough ( Truthfully, I do everything online, so I hardly have to deal with anyone in the office.) The amenities are underwhelming. The pool is barely wade-able, the tennis court is decent, but nothing to rant about, and you have to pay for the gym. The price tag ( although a bit pricey for the caliber of apartment you are getting) is one of cheapest in the city. The area is nice and quiet. If you want somewhere affordable, Beech Lake could be for you, but don't expect anymore than a complex built in the 80's can give you.

Resident
2014 - 2015 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/06/2015
Beech Lake is an awful place to reside, don't let the enhanced pictures fool you. The office staff is unorganized, unprofessional, and not knowledgeable about their own property and proceedings. This is the absolute worst property that I have ever resided in, and I am extremely disappointed because I had high hopes for this dwelling. At first, things were a little shaky and continued to get progressively worse. I cannot wait for my lease to end. The pictures definitely fooled me, as well as the fake friendly smiles the office staff puts on to get your money. Trust me, you should definitely save your money and consider moving elsewhere-- save yourself the headache and drama. If I could have given this property a 0 or a negative 5, that would have been awesome, but instead I had to settle for giving them a 1, as that is the lowest number that is allowed.

First off, I would NOT recommend living here unless of course you like being without water 2-5 times a month for half a day. Some months it was seriously once a week going without water. I know this may sound like a "first world problem" sort of issue, but I'm paying almost 800 bucks a month not including the water and sewer fee; I want water when I want it. Speaking of water, you have 10 minutes before you run out of hot water while showering so use it wisely. Do you enjoy front office staff that drag their feet at every opportunity? How about staff that treat you as a nuisance? What about staff that put in minimal effort in finding your mail or staff that will LOSE YOUR RENT CHECK? If so, then this place is for you. Every time (I kid you not EVERY TIME) I went to get an article of mail that was too large for the mailbox, it either took two visits or gentle goading from me to at least put in a half-assed effort at finding my mail. The staff here is something else, I tell you. There's a lady in the office (or was at any rate) that would bring her dog into the office at times. Other times she would chain the poor thing up outside. I know this because I literally caught him running away and grabbed his chain before he could get any further. The apartments themselves aren't awful, they just aren't worth the money. They're drafty and the walls are paper thin. They haven't been updated in YEARS. But the front office? Updated about 2 years ago. The complex drops all kinds of money for the front office and the grounds surrounding it, but do ABSOLUTELY NOTHING for the tenants living there. Our neighbors were noisy, but the front staff is awful so don't expect them to do anything about it. God have mercy on you should anything go wrong in your apartment. Our air conditioner went out in the summer and it took the wonderful front staff roughly two weeks and several visits and calls from me to get someone to look at it. His response was the following: "Yeah, these units are old and need to be replaced. They clog a lot. It's usually ice in the line. Leave the heat until it dissolves." The heat on...in the summer...yep. A separate time the unit just randomly began leaking. We requested maintenance to come out to look at it and they came in record time at just under 1.5 weeks. He pretty much just said that there was nothing he could do and hopefully no structural damage had been done. I just wouldn't stay here if I were you. I had to because I didn't have the money to move at the time. There are indeed worse apartments, but if you aren't strapped and have options, just go somewhere else.

But that does not make up for the maintenance issues, the noise, its age, hearing my neighbors. My leasing agent has been wonderful and helpful. But when I needed to extend my lease, to extend the writing time on my thesis, noone has been helpful. The manager is trying to raise my rent 50%, from less than $800 to $1220 per month. If I sign a 5 month lease, which is beyond what I need, my rent comes to $900, and increase of 16% and months beyond what I need. I am getting no cooperation. I would not move here, and I greatly regret that I did not move to another place. The laundry room is very small. It has five washers and five driers, for a property with more than 30 buildings... Also, the premium 24 hour fitness center is made to appear large, but it is not much larger than 12' by 15 feet. It is miniscule, and can not hold more than 5 people at a time without being crowded. This is a premium priced, older problem, with alot of problems, and a management staff that could not care less if you move out. Again, I greatly regret moving here and can't wait to leave!!! Do not live here. The management people with Westdale Apartment Management are TERRIBLE. I cannot say it enough. TERRIBLE. Customer service is not a priority for them at all. They are accusatory and condescending and just overall rude. The buildings themselves are older and have not been maintained well. I've lived here for almost 4 years and have seen the management change 3 times. The previous management groups were at least respectful and helpful. We've had continual problems with a leak in our ceiling and as or recently, the AC. Previous management groups would at least fix things promptly when they broke. Last summer, under the new management, we reported a ceiling leak and had it go unanswered for WEEKS. With several followup calls. Every time you call to follow up they act as if it's your fault and that they are just too busy elsewhere doing a crappy job not fixing things. I've called to follow up on a maintenance request and been told the problem had been fixed when, as I'm standing in my apartment, it clearly wasn't and there was no notice left to inform us that anyone had even been in our apartment. We once got a notice that we owed $5 for a "water admin fee" when I called to ask about it, I was told that was a part of my water bill. And when I challenged not having paid an itemized part of my water bill, the girl actually looked it up and said it was for a trash fee. I was furious. Yes, it's $5 but they just made up a charge for this sheet and on top of that I wasn't aware we were supposed to be paying a trash fee. (That's $5 for you to throw your own trash into the dumpster, by the way. Therefore, they're pocketing $5 from 300 apartments.) I might be able to deal with a less nice apartment that needs regular maintenance if that maintenance was performed in a timely manner and the people running the show were nice and actually cared about your happiness. That is so not the case here. Westdale Apartment Management cares nothing for their tennants or customer service. (They tried to tell me once they didn't have my phone number on file...I've lived here 4 years and have definitely conversed with previous managements.) It's my personal feeling they're pushing out the people who have been there so they can further take advantage of newcomers. We're not renewing our lease but I wanted to stay a few extra weeks while closing on my house, which I called and told multiple people in the office and within 24 hours they called to tell me they'd leased the apartment and I had to be out. If only I could contact whoever was moving in and warn them. Also our apartment was broken into once while living here, 2 laptops were stolen. They are also constantly cutting of the water for "repairs." Bottom line, incredibly rude and disrespectful management staff in combination with the constant need to deal with them for maintenance = give your money to someone else.

2011 - 2012 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/15/2012
I have lived in this complex with my husband and 2 yr old son since March 2011, so a little over a year. We had to move somewhere quickly b/c the house we were in before was in a horrible ghetto neighborhood in downtown Durham. I will say it's been safer here, but that's the only good thing I can say. In the time we've lived here the water has been cut off about 8 times, for hours on end, which is too long when you have a baby! I have felt like I live in a 3rd world country in this place, and seeing as our rent has rised to over $800 monthly it's not worth it. We can smell all the smoke( cig & weed ) from the neighbors below us due to poor plumbing around here, and we can hear everything from them. Teenagers take over the "sparkling fountain side gazeebo" and trash it and make tons of noise with no consequences on the weekends. So we just try to stay gone on weekends when we can, which sucks. The maintenance is good BUT we cancelled a request for something and every day when I would leave with my son they were STILL coming into our apt trying to see what something was, and I never knew! They were like ninja's coming and going without leaving a note or anything, I could've had bra's & panties laying out or whatever... I felt SO invaded. One day I ran into one of the guys & he casually mentioned that to me, like "oh we've just been going in there randomly for the past few weeks" Thanks A-holes! I cancelled the friggin request! So now currently they are under new mnmgt and are doing a MAJOR overhaul, the place is a wreck & construction everywhere. They took down a stop sign at the entrance where the gate USED to be (no longer a gated community, thanks guys) and we almost got hit by some idiot flying out of the complex as we were driving in, b/c he had no stop sign of course. We were 1 second away from getting hit on the side my 2 year old was on. Wonderful! I called to ask when they'd be putting the stop sign back up and got a snooty whatever whatever response from a staff member. Thanks for caring about my family's safety guys, such a warm & fuzzy feeling to live here. Not.

Resident
2012 - 0 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/10/2012
On May 10, 2012, the water supply was cut off for (as of now) more than 3 hours. Yes, that means no plumbing. The worst water experience I have ever had in another apartment complex prior to this, was a lack of hot water. Yes, Beech Lake did give warning in advance the water would be cut off, a few days in advance in fact. This is my only experience so far of such a thing happening at Beech Lake, but losing plumbing makes me wonder if I am still living in a first world country. Of all the things to lose (Internet, hot water, even electricity), plumbing should come last. To be fair, this hasn't happened prior and I have lived here some months. The water company is still outside, working hard. The problem will probably resolve in a few hours, but it is late at night and I am irritated (UPDATE later during the night of May 10, 2012 - it is between 10 and 10:30 pm and water is back). I will be fair and give some nice points about this place, compared to other rental places I have seen - 1) Very nice office workers - They answer the phone courteously and are very polite. 2) Very nice maintenance crew 3) Very nice leasing agents - One leasing agent works in the office too. 4) Convenient short-term 3 month leases, with a convenient month-to-month option if you do not renew your initial lease. It is not so easy to find a convenient lease like this and also pay less than 900 dollars a month. 5) Hardly any bugs - I have lived in horror places and positively hate bugs, and I am very pleased in this department over here. I've occasionally seen a small spider run across the wall, but they stick to walls only. 6) Very spacious one bedroom apartment compared to other places, even in this area where property is cheap - the main living area as well as bedroom are big! You get plenty of inbuilt closet space in the bedroom, two closet areas in the kitchen, and one small storage room where the washer and dryer connections are (you can rent a washer and dryer for 40 dollars a month - I left the connections unused and use the on-site laundry facility instead, and consequently have even more storage space). Now some negatives (to be honest, not all are the complex's fault): It's the people higher-up who are doing things wrong - they are not investing funds in important areas. The entrance right outside my ground-floor apartment is really shabby - the stairs and exterior walls are poorly painted and look old and decrepit. I probably have to maintain this area on my own since cobwebs (and spiders) are routinely outside, next to my front door. I often hear occasionally foot steps from upstairs, and toilet flushing. Nothing else that is private. There is too much mud everywhere outside, including right outside the ground floor apartment. This may not be a problem for you. I found it cold here in April. I ran the main wall heater on, an hour or so every day for many days in April, and got an electricity bill between 70-80 dollars. I won't be here in winter and that is a relief - I don't have the budget for a huge electricity bill. Perhaps my feeling of cold is subjective, perhaps it was just weird weather in April, or maybe there is an insulation problem. At any rate, you have some idea of what kind of utility bill you may get. Walking inside the complex, you feel it is spacious with lots of trees, few cars and few people. But, there are too many large dogs which only become a problem when you are walking right outside the complex - I don't enjoy jostling for space with a dog on the narrow sidewalk where you wait for the bus. This however, is not the complex's fault as they can't really change the location- the entire area (including outside Harris Teeter and Car Mike which are in walking distance) has too narrow sidewalks for both dog lovers and dog haters to walk side by side. For someone without a car who also dislikes dogs in my personal space, this is an inconvenience many rentals in this area have. I think there may not be a single rental complex in Durham or Chapel Hill that doesn't allow dogs (you have to go to an individual owner for that). I found a place though with hardly any dog owners, and that is much cheaper, and also is more to my liking - much less mud, nature, etc, and a much more finished exterior look which I don't have to worry about maintaining. The much better exterior will be a reason due to which I won't be embarrassed to call friends over. It also fares well on bugs (none according to reviews I read online), just like Beech Lake fares well. Of course, it is also a much longer lease (a year's lease) but now I actually know that I want to be in this area longer. So, Beech Lake may be unavoidable for many trying to transition to this area and save money as compared to an extended stay hotel. But whether you choose to stay longer depends on your needs.

2009 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 08/10/2011
Pros: updating the landscape, looks nice recycling on-site valet trash service 5 nights a week plenty of parking can't really hear my neighbors in the apartments next to me low electric bills (in the $40's during summer and winter peak temperatures, in the $30's otherwise) lots of closet space, fireplace, big laundry room Cons: Maintenance comes quickly about half the time, and about half the time fixes the thing correctly. It's not that unusual for them not to come at all, or to say they are returning to finish fixing something and not return at all. Office staff are not always very pleasant to deal with. The gates are broken, and have been broken for 20 of the 24 months I've lived here. Serious lack of security. People have loud parties at the pool at all hours of the night, and without enforcement, the 10-10 pool hours are a joke. The stuff about cars getting broken into and neighbors fighting seems to be true, unfortunately. Pets require a $300 deposit AND pet rent. You have to give 60 days notice and it costs an extra $200 a month to go month-to-month, so unless you live your life in 12 month increments, maybe look somewhere that allows for life to happen I have to agree that something seems up with the water. I drink it and I'm fine, but my sinks smell awful and no amount of bleach seems to help The fitness center is woefully inadequate. They say it's state of the art, but only if it were on the Titanic in 1912. And even the Titanic had a rowing machine. I'm in a bottom floor apartment and I can hear every step my upstairs neighbors make. It's loud enough that it wakes me up in the middle of the night. I have a lot of bugs in my apartment. They do spray every quarter and will come more often if you ask them, but it doesn't seem to stop the hundreds of little tiny black ones that are in my bedroom.

2010 - 2011 Not Recommended Reviewed 03/18/2011
This apartment complex is one of the worst to reside in in Durham. To start off, the management is unorganized and inconsistent,and sarcastic. They never have their facts together. I have experienced bad customer service ever since I moved out here, from the maintenance repairs to complex issues. The maintenance crew never efficiently fix anything. Everything they do is rigged up and a temporary fix. My garbage disposal, ice maker , dryer and a number of other things went bad on several different occasions, and were not fixed appropiately. On top of that , they cut the water source off completely not once but twice for an unestimated amount of time, and speaking of water it has an unbearing stinch which smells of rotting eggs or hair relaxer that is obviously contaminated. There are several car break ins and the tenants arent notified until weeks and weeks later. They havent had a gym nor a club house since i started my lease in apr of 2010. Lastly they TRY to make you pay a full months rent when you do not re new your lease in the month where you intend to move out ( meaning you are evacuating the property before 30 days) and they insist on mailing you the remaining of the pro rated rent within 30 days, which is not included in the lease agreement. In all of my rental years I have never experienced such an atrocity!. They should be shut down due to health violations (water issues) and safety. I will not be renewing my lease there, if you currently reside there I'm sorry for you if you are contemplating on choosing this as your next home, seriously re-consider, its a headache and an awful experience.

Resident
2006 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/11/2011
I rented this apartment since November 2006 till the end of 2010. I was satisfied with the conditions and services of Beech Lake apartments for the first two years. But in 2009 the staff was completely changed and problems started. The fridge in my apartment began to work improperly. They replaced it only in two weeks after I firstly reported by an old rusty one. Late in 2009 and at the beginning 2010, they started installing water-meters throughout the community. They broke the door to the small cabinet where the meter was installed. I informed the leasing office about this problem. No one ever came to look at it. A month later, I informed them once again. I handed in the list of issues to be taken care of in my apartment. No one came, nothing was done. I regret that I extended my leasing contract for another year .Later on my life in this community converted to a nightmare with a lot of noise and dirt. The passenger window of my car was smashed to bits. An outrageous incident occurred on September 10 2010 when they hired workers to replace walkways near my apartment. Workers started to splinter with concrete just two steps from my car. As a result the body, of car was uniformly covered with dents from concrete rocky stones. On windshield there were many scratches of size up to 2.5 millimeters. I tried to speak to the community manager but she refused to talk to me. Some manager later inspected my car. Three weeks have passed but no one even tried to solve the problem by offering me any kind of damage compensation . After that, I immediately informed them that I would not extend my leasing contract. No reaction. I informed them again later on. No reaction again. When I informed them for the third time, the assistant manager declared that I must rent my apartment on a month-to-month-rate basis for two months before I can move out.. Lastly, they took about $200 out of my security deposit without any explanation. They merely stole this money. To summarize, guys never rent from Beech Lake apartments. They are the worst ones out of many places where I lived in Durham.

2001 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 01/03/2011
My son and I lived there for nearly 2 years. The first year was good, but the second year, the place went to h*** -- rude neighbors, all kinds of illicit activities in the parking lots, including gunshots, drug deals, and prostitution. I broke my lease and paid the penalty to get us out of there. Beechlake tried to charge me for repairs to the place that were not damages that occurred while living there, including replacing all of the carpeting through out the place and at an extremely high cost. I refused to pay, they sent it to collections. I eventually paid it off to save my credit, but Beechlake changed management and lost records of my payments, so after 7 years, it reappeared on my credit report as Unpaid. So my advice to prospective renters is to AVOID THIS PLACE. My advise to the current renters is to TAKE PICTURES AND GET WITNESSES for the condition of the apt. once you move out! Otherwise, they may try to take you to the cleaners with charges!

2007 - 2009 Not Recommended Reviewed 10/05/2010
I lived here for two years. The second year was only because we were too lazy to move again so soon. That we regret. My apartment (6G, 2bdrm) and beech lake experience sucked because: -When toured the apt. there we some things that needed to be repaired. When we moved in, they had not repaired any of them and it was up to us to file maintenance requests until they were taken care of. That's poor as I assumed these things would have been taken care of prior to move in. -Stinky with mold smells, especially the cabinetry and the poorly ventilated bedroom bathroom. -AC/heating broke numerous times and although the maintenance folks are nice, good people trying to do their job, the repair methods are basically trial and error. It was annoying to say the least. -Unfriendly neighbors, and half didn't seem to speak English... -Thin floors walls -Pipe in the bathroom wall burst and the place flooded with about 2in water everywhere! They did pay for a 3 day hotel stay while they ripped up the carpet, stuck giant fans under it had a big dehumidifier running. They had helped us move a lot of our furniture onto the porch covered it with a tarp. In retrospect, our valuables could have easily been stolen. The place seemed dry when we moved back in but I'm sure it only added more mold issues... The only good thing out of this, I suppose, is at the time they had insurance so we were financially reimbursed for most of our damaged stuff. Of course photos such are irreplaceable... -When we moved out, we were charged for the carpet to be replaced, and they had inaccurate records of the prior flood in their computer records. We tried to fight this but didn't win, and didn't have the time to deal with their crap. -Some of the people working in the office were nice, but you could tell they hated working there... a lot of residents probably bitching to get problems resolved unsuccessfully. One lady acted like a total botch when we tried to fight the carpet replacement stuff. It was like talking to a stupid wall. -Not the safest neighborhood though things did seem to be well lit outside. Btw, someone was shot in one of the apartments. This was on the news briefly otherwise I probably wouldn't have known about it. -Three dryers in the laundry room worked very poorly. Damp results! The good things about beech lake: -The layout of our apartment was decent the square footage was large for a 2bdrm -The landscape outside was fairly well maintained -Enough parking -There was a pool Find a better place to live!

Resident
2009 - 2010 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/21/2010
I learned about Beech Lake a couple years ago from a friend who lived there. She had a great experience, so I decided to sign a lease. It was great in the beginning. Nice place, good price, etc... My car was broken into twice (we think it was from someone who lives in the complex), and the entire move-out process is enough to make me write this bad review. Be sure to read your lease in detail -- they need at least 60 days notice for your move-out date - I'm talking about even if your move-out date is the day that your lease is up. If you fail to give them notice, they will charge you rent for 60-days AFTER the last day of your lease. Also, I think they are now charging renters for the water bill and valet trash services. We moved out and had to pay an extra 30 days of rent, and I just received a bill in the mail for $60 worth of water that was supposedly used between the time I moved out and 30 days after. The electricity bill also reflects that someone was using the electricity after we moved out and turned in the keys. They will encourage you to move out and turn the keys in so that they can 're-rent' the property (and give you back what you paid) -- DO NOT BELIEVE THEM. These people are SHADY in the office and will tell you one thing, and pretend they never said it in the first place. For example, they knew I was moving out AT least 60 days prior to the lease being up, yet never told me to my face that I needed to have anything in writing. I could probably give 50 more examples, but please just do yourself a favor and live somewhere else.

Report
Resident
2006 - 2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/12/2008
I lived in the community for almost 4 years. I had always had positive interactions with the management staff until the management company changed. There seems to be a general lack of caring now. I moved out in mid February and now at the end of March I have yet to receive my security deposit back. I've been calling and have stopped by on several occasions trying to see when I could expect to receive my deposit back. I've been given different dates and the "oh, the person that handles that is out of the office" spiel on more than one occasion. I gave up on calling the Beech Lake office and resorted to calling the managment company directly. After telling the person that answered the phone my information , she said that she would call me back. This was after I told her that I had been promised that the check would be mailed on March 29. I called back and was told that she was writing the checks now (March 31). From what I've been able to research the management company has 30 days according to NC law to refund the security deposit. Since I'm well beyond that 30 day mark, I asked if my check could be overnighted. The lady sounded quite suprised that I would make this request. I would not recommend moving into this complex if you expect to receive your security deposit back within a reasonable amount of time. I still stand by most of what is said below. My service requests have always been handled with 24 hours of making the request. There have been times that I've received same day service. I had an issue with my dishwasher within the first month of moving into the apartment. After two attempts to fix the problem failed, I recieved a new dishwasher. All of the appliances in my apartment were replaced with new ones early in 2008. During the replacement of the appliances the kitchen counter was damaged and the new exhaust fan housing exposed parts of the cabinets and walls that had not been painted. I made several trips to the office requesting repairs, but nothing happed. I took a written repair request to the office on Tuesday, September 9, 2008. By Thursday evening most of the repairs had been completed. The maintenance technican left a note informing me of why it would take multiple trips to address all of my issues. Overall, I'm satisfied with my apartment, with the exception that the apartment never gets warm and the heater runs all the time, even though it is set to reach a certain temperature and then cut off. My last electric bill was well over $100 for a one bedroom apartment with one person living there. That is not acceptable. The security gates are an issue. The actual moving parts of the gates have been removed, so there isn't one anymore. I didn't have any issues with hearing my neighbors, until a person moved in upstairs with a dog with behavior issues. I could hear the dog running up and down the hall at all hours during the day and night. They also left the balcony door open so the dog would be able to got outside if it wanted to. This wouldn't have been much of an issue, except this dog doesn't like people and runs to the open window or stands on it hind legs growling and barking. I've been afraid on several occasions that the dog was going to jump over the edge of the balcony or run through the window screen. It's not much better when the dog is taken outside for a walk. I've not had any issues with darkness in the parking lots or in the entry way leading to my apartment. The one time the light blew, it was fixed the next evening. I've learned that not everything in any apartment is going to be perfect, but you have to decide what you are or are not willing to accept. Everything is subject to personal interpretation.

Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/10/2008
A few good things before we get into the awful part of this complex: Usable floorplans.Good parking.Water and Sewage included. Affordable rent, but be aware that your rent price is given as a "concession" so that if you are ever late on a rent payment they can jack up your rent for the rest of your lease terms. Prompt maintainence response times The BAD: The condition of my apartment was awful when I moved in. The cabinets didn't close. There were marks all over the walls, even some dry wall missing exposing rusty screws. Part of my balcony was not painted. Even worse, my dishwasher and bathroom sink leaked. Furthermore, my refrigerator had wires hanging down from the bulb and rocked b/c one foot wasn't level (ie a safety hazard). Like other posters have metioned, they did a complete repipe of the complex. I was only given 2 days notice, which is absurd. I was supposed to receive a $35 application refund because I am a grad student, which I had to fight tooth and nail to receive. Additionally, because my power was not turned on the exact day my lease started (Duke power was unable to turn it on until 2 days later, despite the fact that I contacted them over a week ahead of time), I was charged a $25 late penalty in addition to over charge on the electricity. When I complained, I was chastised for not having my power turned on in time. I give up. The gates never work and the lighting around the complex is bad. My parking lot is very dark. I don't have very high expectations of apartment complexes or management, but this is ridiculous. They give you this sense that they care and are willing to work with you, and then treat you like an idiot and a child. The appliances were also not the ones shown to me in the model, which I specifically asked about when touring. Mine are significantly older. My next door neighbor, however, got new ones before moving in. Supposedly my representative did a complete walk through, but she must have been blind. Seriously! There were so many problems upon move in. And it definitely isnt worth the hassle. The work-out room is a joke. Its dirty and gross and looks like there is mold growing in the vents. I'm sure other places are worse, but the management here is bad and that is enough to make me move when my lease is up.

Resident
2008 Not Recommended Reviewed 09/07/2008
We've been living here for 7 months now, and cannot wait to get out. The whole "gated community" sales pitch is a joke. If the gates aren't broken, they stay open long enough for at least 5 cars to pull in behind you. After several people driving into them, you would think they'd be smart enough to install a security camera to see who's doing it. The management staff always acts like they care about your concerns, until it comes down to acting on them. We just had a re-pipe of the entire unit, where a company came in and left our apartments unlocked (and unaccompanied for the most part) from about 8am-7pm, they broke 2 of our doors, which we reported and still no one has come to fix them. We still have work orders in from the day we moved in that have not been acted upon. It can get quite noisy with people on their balconys, but I started wearing ear plugs to bed so I don't notice the noise anymore. The demographics here are pretty mixed, but half the time I feel like I'm living in the ghetto. My boyfriend travels during the week, so I'm alone often, and I do not feel very secure. A child could probably pick the locks. When I expressed my concerns about my security to a member of management, they asked what building I lived in, and when I answered they said "ohhhh". One positive thing I will say, is that the scenery is very nice. We feel like we live in a treehouse, so it can be very peaceful. I think we are just living on the wrong side of the tracks. It seems like the apartments that are located on the same side of the office are in a much nicer area.

Upon touring these grounds three times as a future resident, I heard maintenance talking about water leakages, bug issues, and the gate was broken. At first, the managment had promised us a deal of $577 if we acted in the next ten days. We responded in two days, but suddenly the deal was gone and there were no stipulations when they first drew us in. I monitored their availablilities everyday. On the day that a one bedroom opened up, I called the management to confirm that the apartment was still available and at the price listed on the website. They said yes and I asked them if they could hold the apartment for me as I drove up there within the hour that same day. The management said yes. Upon arrival at the resident office, I was informed that the room I reserved was taken and was on reserve by someone else. (Conveniently), they had several other more expensive rooms available that weren't listed on their website for me to take a look at. I instructed them that I had come there for a particular room and told them that they wasted a half a tank of my gas. I considered this an omen of bad things to come if I were to actually stay here.

Okay. I'll say this slowly for the pseudo intellectuals out there. When you have a unit rented, it is not removed from online advertising in real time. If you were an hour away and had not put any money down to hold the apartment, then you have no claim to it whatsoever. Most likely, when you hung up the phone to get in your car and foolishly use 1/2 tank of gas, someone walked into the office and put actual money in their hand to hold the apartment. With no money from you, your phone call wasn't worth the time it took to dial the number, let alone the fuel costs. Money talks, -------- runs the marathon. Take this idiot's advise and waste more money on attorney's fees if you would like. No money exchanged hands and they did not have you sign a contract agreeing to one price only to insist you pay another. You made the trip of your own free will. If you were really that far away, and if gas were really an issue, an intelligent person would have applied and secured the apartment online. Most, if not all, apartments offer this option. But, maybe that's too complicated. Tell me who sounds more full of crap. Me, or the person who is, not so cleverly, disquising an advertisement for legal services as a comment from a concerned reader. You didn't by chance ask this person for whom they work? 2007 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 06/30/2008
Beech Lake is very peaceful. There are mature trees, and great views of the pond if you have a building surrounding it. The gazebo, fountain, and resident ducks only add to it! I have had no problems with noise or neighbors. Parking is always available right near the apartment. The only problems experienced in the last year are minor. The towel racks don't stay on the wall and the gates are broken frequently since people hit them- however, gates don't provide real security to begin with since people can piggy-back in behind other cars. Management has been changing around alot, so I am not sure how the current management is.

Resident
2007 - 2008 Recommended Property Reviewed 03/10/2008
My husband and I have completely enjoyed living here at Beech Lake apartments! Every view out the window is lovely. I can even see the lake from my bed. There are nice floors and in the 8 months we've lived here, they installed a BRAND NEW fridge, dishwasher, and stove/oven, AND upgraded the gym with all new machines. The people at the office greet every tenant by name and always know which apartment we live in. I enjoy jogging around the lake and feeding the two ducks that live here. I am often not the only ones feeding them! Parking has never been a problem, nor has noise. We have loved our wood burning fireplace. The only real problem we've had is that our towel rack fell down in the bathroom, but the maintenance has always responded quickly when we alert them. The only reason we are moving is because we are moving to a different state for career purposes.

Resident
2006 - 2007 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/31/2007
Let me first say that my experience at Beech Lake has not been entirely negative. However, when I was first moving in, I sent my sister to get the key. Now, I had called the leasing office a few days before, and they said I had to come in and sign a little waiver-type thing allowing someone other than me to get the key... I did, but when she went to pick it up, they didn't ask her name and they didn't check her ID. All she said (unless for some reason my sister was lying to me) was that she was there to pick up a key for her sister (she didn't even say my name), and they just handed it over, which was a little nervous. Maintenance is also sometimes right on top of things (when they are on top of things, they're excellent and almost everyone has been super friendly) and sometimes seems not to have a clue. I think it's probably a lot to do with poor communication with office staff. Weeks before I moved in, the manager and I had a discussion about getting a handful of things done before I actually moved in. In actuality, none of that happened until several days to weeks later, and after many, many phone calls. One person even left a huge shard of glass (broken and several feet long) in my dining area. There's also been an issue with my dogs. From the beginning, I requested to have a phone call a day in advance if someone would be entering my apartment, because I wanted to crate the dogs before someone came in. My concern was not only for my dogs (running out into the parking lot, etc.), but also for the maintenance staff, in case they had an issue (my dogs tend to be very jump-happy around strangers). Many times I would simply get a call the day of (You're at work? Can you come home and put the dogs away?). Then it turned into "We know you like to be at the apartment when work is being done". Again, just another indication that the leasing office does not seem to be on top of what's going on. There have been some very nice things, however. I seemed to get a pretty good deal when I moved in, and I really like the layout of the apartment (though it's on the older side of things and isn't constructed the best -- kitchen/bathroom counters tend to fall apart because it's just pressboard or whatever). I also had sort of a creepy stalker situation which one particular person in the office handled with a lot of grace, which I appreciated a lot. And after all the maintenance/dog drama, the office staff did send a nice card with a gift card to PETCO, which I thought was wonderfully sweet. There were also some new appliances that were recently installed... though I was only told the night before at about 6:00 pm that they were going to be replaced the next day (have you ever tried emptying your refrigerator and freezer and finding coolers for everything in one night? And just days before Thanksgiving, no less). I'll also note on the "gated community" bit - not so much. Sometimes the gate is working, sometimes not. Horribly inconsistent, really. The key pad for dialing in is AWFUL (you have to scroll through every single name in the community, which sucks if you're looking for someone who say, has a "W" last name), and most people just end up tailing someone else through anyway since the gate timing allows at least two cars to go through, and at most probably three or four. As for neighbors, most people are very friendly, and I think I lucked out having mostly quiet people around me (especially the fellow upstairs). It's also wonderful if you have pets (though the $300 pet fee is annoying, most places do have some sort of pet fee, if not pet rent); my dogs often play with lots of other dogs in the surrounding buildings. Not sure yet if I'll stay. Depends on the rent for the upcoming year. However, looking at the current rent prices, I'll say that for the amount of money, you could probably do better somewhere else.
Let me first say that my experience at Beech Lake has not been entirely negative. However, when I was first moving in, I sent my sister to get the key. Now, I had called the leasing office a few days before, and they said I had to come in and sign a little waiver-type thing allowing someone other than me to get the key... I did, but when she went to pick it up, they didn't ask her name and they didn't check her ID. All she said (unless for some reason my sister was lying to me) was that she was there to pick up a key for her sister (she didn't even say my name), and they just handed it over, which was a little nervous. Maintenance is also sometimes right on top of things (when they are on top of things, they're excellent and almost everyone has been super friendly) and sometimes seems not to have a clue. I think it's probably a lot to do with poor communication with office staff. Weeks before I moved in, the manager and I had a discussion about getting a handful of things done before I actually moved in. In actuality, none of that happened until several days to weeks later, and after many, many phone calls. One person even left a huge shard of glass (broken and several feet long) in my dining area. There's also been an issue with my dogs. Resident
2006 - 2007 Not Recommended Reviewed 12/02/2007
I moved into Beech Lake last year. I have had so many problems since moving here that I'm leaving at the end of my lease. First of all, let me say, when i first moved in, things were great. I love the layout of the apartment for me and my little boy. However, I turned in my move in inspection, nothing to this day has been fixed. Secondly, all the good office staff are gone, only to be replaced with complete dummies who don't know what they are talking about. Josh, who was a leasing agent, is now the manager. WTF?? Don't know who made that call, but that was the worse thing that could have happened. When i moved in, i had appliances from the 80's in here. Only one eye worked on my stove....try warming bottles at 3 am and cooking dinner with only one eye. Not to mention, when i turned on the burner, it would spark. I complained. 8 months later, i got a new stove. Then a month after that, they "upgraded" the aparments with what they say was stainless steele applances. Well, sorry sweetie, but they are stainless steele plastic. But they are nice. It figures i would only get to enjoy them for 2 months before I move out. The "gated" community is BS. The gates have maybe worked 1 month since i moved in. If you have digital phone service through time warner, you can only have one phone hooked up in the whole apartment. I was told when they came to hook up my phones, that the way the lines were set up, you couldn't split it to all the rooms. Parking is horrible. I live in a building where one tenant has 4 cars parked. 3 of which are broken down. The management has been in the process of "towing" them for months now. Meanwhile, when I get home from work, i have to park at another building and walk to mine with my infant son in the dark. There was a gentleman selling drugs out of his aparment on the first floor. I went to Josh and told him what was going on. I ONLY told him. He assured me it would be taken care of. 3 weeks later, i went to pick up a package, and some random leasing agent that was new and I had never spoken to before, asked me (in front of an office full of residents and employees) if the "drug problem in my building" was taken care of. I was horrified. I played it off telling her she had the wrong person, and trying to give her some sign to shut up, but she continued saying, "weren't you the one who reported the gentleman selling drugs in your building." I just replied that I didn't know what she was talking about and walked out. I reported this to the management company and have yet to hear of a response. I later found out that one of the maint. guys was buddies with the guy i reported, and he told him that I reported him. This guy, who lived below me and used to be cordial, now just stares at me. Every time he sees me come home, he closes all his blinds. It has made living here scary and uncertain. Finally, when i called the 800 number to renew my lease, they jacked my rent up almost 100 dollars. When I told them i wouldn't pay that much, they told me they would call me back with a better offer, they called back with 10 bucks less than they offered before. The apartment itself is nice. They are older, but if you get a unit like mine, that was taken care of by the previous tenant, then it's okay. However, the management and parking sucks so bad, it makes a great apartment, suck.

This was by far my worst living experience ever! I was a graduate student, so the cheap rent was nice. However, the unit was in HORRIBLE shape. My roommate and I made a list of problems with it when we first arrived, and about a third of them were actually fixed by the time we left. The ceiling also collapsed at one point during the year, and they stopped the leak but did not patch up the hole in the ceiling. <br><br>I also traveled a lot for my research, and came home once to find that they changed my locks and cleaned the carpets without telling me. I then had to wait several hours for the EMERGENCY maintenance person to come let me into my apartment.<br><br>The icing on the cake was that the last month I lived there I received a bill for $0 for that month. Resident
2005 - 2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/10/2006
I knew some people who lived in Beech Lake before moving here myself. A few of them have great apartments where nothing ever breaks and the cheap rent makes the place a bargain.<br><br>I have an utterly rundown unit. Every appliance with the exception of the refrigerator has broken. The closet doors routinely crack and fall off the sliding rails. Insulation is poor so you'll be facing sky high heating bills in the winter, that is, if your heat actually works. The same goes for the AC in the summer. Plumbing problems abound and worst of all, there are "critters" everywhere--squirrels in the ceiling, spiders all over the bathroom, wasps on my balcony, and sometimes there is even something (who knows what)banging around in the fireplace.<br><br>The neglect extends to the common areas as well. The pool here is perpetually closed and the gate on one side of the complex is perpetually broken. There are also potholes everywhere inside the complex.<br><br>The leasing office which is much improved over last year's staff (the complex was purchased by a different management company in 2005)is still not always on top of things. You often have to lodge complaints 2 or 3 times before anything is ever fixed.<br><br>The bottom line is that Beech Lake is an old complex which has not been well maintained. If you luck out and get a nice unit with working appliances, you are getting a good deal. The rest of you will suffer.

Resident
2004 - 2006 Not Recommended Reviewed 05/03/2006
I've lived here at Beech Lake for two years...my lease expires in June and my roommate and I will both be leaving for greener pastures.<br><br>When we first moved in, it was great. Beautiful views, decent price, good location. The AC broke on move-in day but they provided me with a window unit until the AC could be fixed (it was July 4th weekend, so -everything- was understandably closed). The disposal broke a week later and they replaced it with a brand new one the next day.<br><br>The warm fuzzies end there. The first year was decent...there was one girl in the office who was fantastic. But then the management changed (we're currently on either the third or fourth set...I don't remember) and it all went downhill.<br><br>Small issues: The walkway lights burn out constantly and it takes a week to fix them even if you tell them about it repeatedly. There are wasps on our porch/in our storage room rendering them completely unusable and the management's response was "Well, everyone has wasps..." Our patio door came away from the molding and so wasps were getting into our apartment...took them a week and two reminders to fix it. Not to mention that every time the repair guy came to "look" at it he implied that it was somehow our fault that there were wasps IN our apartment.<br><br>Big issues: Our security chain broke (!) six months ago and they've never replaced it. When I signed the lease two years ago, we were promised a free carpet cleaning if we renewed our lease the next year. We did, but at that point had pets. I asked if we could wait until the pets left (I was watching them for a friend) to get the carpet cleaned and was told that was fine. The pets left, and I asked if we could get our carpet cleaned. They said they were no longer doing that program. I said they owed me a carpet cleaning, program or not. We've been trying to get the carpet cleaned for 10 months now, to no avail. Every time I ask about it (at least once a month) there's some different response. Now they're saying that since we're moving out soon they'll just clean the carpet then and not charge us if it's dirty. But that's only part of the issue. The big part of the issue is that they LIED and are not upholding part of the agreement. I don't care if they clean the carpet two days in a row...they're going to clean it before I move out.<br><br>There are also bugs everywhere, the windows leak cold air in the winter and hot air in the summer, the bathrooms and kitchens are dirty no matter how much you clean them, the soundproofing is awful, we can smell everything our neighbors cook for dinner (curry and cigarettes). The gates work -maybe- two days a month. Maybe.<br><br>Don't be fooled by the pretty trees and the tranquility...you do not want to live here. <br><br>

The second apartment had no mold and was in better shape. The actual apartment has been fine to live in, except when the thermostat broke (the apartment heated to over 100 degrees). Despite the fact that I live here and after several requests they still do not send my rent statement to my Beech Lake address. Report
Resident
2002 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 07/24/2004
The recent ratings scoring Beech Lake as a wonderful, safe, and cooperative environment have been most likely submitted by the management to mislead prospective renters. The community is NOT safe, apartment and auto break-ins are frequent and the staff turnover has been consistent for sometime. There is the perception of security with a so-called gated entry system but there is a portion of the complex which is not gated and the management has promised to correct this inconsistency for nearly three years. Their excuse is "cost." Insects AND reptilian visitors are not uncommon, including lizards and snakes which make one a little uncomfortable venturing out after dark not to mention the poor lighting which makes the property very dangerous particularly for women moving about unescorted. The Durham Police have visited the community on two ocassions that I'm aware of trying to get residents to do a community watch which indicates that the reason they were on the property was because there WAS an increase in crime. Most residents I've spoken with do NOT feel safe, and guarantees from the ever changing management have not yielded any results to at least address the problems of safety and security. One incident occured a year ago when residents learned of an attempted rape from the news - the management didn't even have the courtesy of informing residents that they should be MORE aware of their surroundings which was offensive to those of us living there at the time. You decided but be wary - they are managed by a large company with little to no concern for the local residents who have to call the property home. Most people DO NOT stay for long once they've been violated and the situation does not appear to be changing. There are many communities in the area that do provide additional levels of security. Beech Lake is NOT one of them. Go elsewhere of run the risk of losing your property, or worse!

Resident
2001 - 2003 Not Recommended Reviewed 02/11/2004
First, the pros. There are many: great layouts, abundant parking, beautiful grounds, a lake with a pavillion you can use for get-togethers. I got a one-bed, one-den since it was me and my husband, not a roomate so we weren´t going to use two bedrooms...but we did want two bedrooms of space. This is an affordable option, and made a great starter apartment. The complex is not new, but it is only from the 1980s...it´s not really old either. <br> <br>The problems can be boiled down to one major issue: the management is awful. I know they changed staff, many times in fact while I was there, but they were always replacing incompetent uncaring employees with incompetent uncaring employees. I don´t care if they smiled at me - they never did anything for me and aside from the smiles they were quite combative. During a heat wave our air conditioner broke - it remained broken for over a week while the temps exceeded 100 on my third floor apartment. I couldn´t open the sliding door either, since they never answered my many requests to have the screen fixed. In the two years I was there, they never washed the exteriors of the windows, which had a yellow pollin film and bird stuff. <br> <br>The exercise room, which I was assured on a tour was near renovation, never was updated from it´s 1980´s teal and pink squiggly sweatstained wallpaper. There were about three items of equipment, and at any given time only one or two worked. I bought a washer and dryer because the laundry room was unpleasant. I tried to rent the clubhouse for a dinner party, which they told me on tour I could do...but when I tried to do it they said that it wasn´t available for rentals anymore. <br> <br>In this housing market, you can rent a three or four bedroom, pleasant house for what you pay for these apartments. Do that instead.

I don´t care if they smiled at me - they never did anything for me and aside from the smiles they were quite combative. During a heat wave our air conditioner broke - it remained broken for over a week while the temps exceeded 100 on my third floor apartment. I couldn´t open the sliding door either, since they never answered my many requests to have the screen fixed. In the two years I was there, they never washed the exteriors of the windows, which had a yellow pollin film and bird stuff. <br> <br>The exercise room, which I was assured on a tour was near renovation, never was updated from it´s 1980´s teal and pink squiggly sweatstained wallpaper. There were about three items of equipment, and at any given time only one or two worked. I bought a washer and dryer because the laundry room was unpleasant. I tried to rent the clubhouse for a dinner party, which they told me on tour I could do...but when I tried to do it they said that it wasn´t available for rentals anymore. <br> <br>In this housing market, you can rent a three or four bedroom, pleasant house for what you pay for these apartments. Do that instead. Read less

Leasing

Live along the peaceful shores of a beautiful spring-fed lake at Beech Lake, a wonderful apartment community set on 40 wooded acres in southwest Durham, just minutes from Duke, North Carolina Central, The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and the Research Triangle Park. When you're home, relax on your patio or balcony and drink in the views. Unwind by the pool or socialize in the clubhouse. You can stay in shape working out in our brand new fitness center or enjoying a game of tennis on our lighted courts. These charming homes feature wood burning fireplaces, fully eqipped kitchens, washer and dryer connections, generous closet space, and amazing floor plans. With gorgeous landscaping, amenities for every lifestyle, 5-star customer service, and easy access to all of the Universities and major employers, you'll find coming home is the best part of your day.
